intro: Clidemia interrupta, commonly known as the Hawaiian stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often reddish stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Clidemia interrupta is also known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
